intro: Erigeron villosus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, and it thrives in a variety of soil types. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance, and its flowers are usually pale yellow to white. Erigeron villosus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
